lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Really appreciate that. And for those who tuned in for him and supporting: thank you guys. Quick little shout-out. We had actually one of our fellow Critters come find us out in the desert this past week. So a shout-out to our friend Scott from Boise, Idaho. Operator, thank you so much for coming and visiting. It was awesome getting to chat with you, and it was cool.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, that was a surrealist experience.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Also, Welovefine is running a t-shirt design contest for the upcoming Rage of Dragons Dungeons and Dragons release, and they've asked me to be one of the judges of that contest. So all you people with an artistic bone in your body, go ahead and design some t-shirts. Go to welovefine.com, check out the contest rules for the Rage of Demons contest. But I'll be judging your designs! And hopefully if yours is appreciated by me and all the other judges, you'll be getting a cash prize and have your shirts officially sanctioned by D&D and put on welovefine.com, so check that out! That's a cool thing! I've already seen some great art. Some people have floated over to Twitter. If I haven't responded, it's because I'm a judge and I probably shouldn't. (laughs) But everything looks cool, so thank you guys for your submissions.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you accept cash bribes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) No. Other cool announcements. Oh! Once again, every week we have our hundred sub giveaway. Every hundred subs we get, we have a giveaway with somebody randomly within the chat who is actively in the chat. This involves a picture of the cast, signed, one of our posters from our fantastic official artist Kit Buss, signed, and for a few short giveaways, we'll also be giving away a copy of this Pen to Paper Imaginary Friend book that we received, gifted to us by 826LA. It's a book of a collection of stories from the kids that have been tutored at 826LA that told stories about their imaginary friends and what they were like, and their adventures. And they had a lot of talented artists and animators come in and actually illustrate what these imaginary friends look like and what their experiences are with those imaginary friends. So we'll be giving one of these away with each one of those hundred sub giveaways to you guys who have been so gracious in helping support 826LA.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes. And we went today!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We went today to 826LA to deliver a nice, big, fatty check to them from you guys, and they were blown away by it. We got to teach a bunch of young kids the basics of Dungeons and Dragons, and we gave them copies of the books to hopefully start a few games of their own there, so thank you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This was such a great experience, and we took video of it, so hopefully we'll have that edited and maybe sometime next week or the week after, you guys can see and learn a little bit about this charity that we support and talk about every week.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep, we'll have a cool video up. It'll show you guys our whole experience at 826LA delivering and talking to them about everything, so that'll be fun! Other announcements: This is one of the gifts that we're actually talking about at the start of the stream because we want to utilize it through it. A fantastic gentleman by the name of Jim Donnis sent us custom Vox Machina etched glasses. Customized character glass icons. I have my Dungeon Master glass here. So that's really awesome. And also sent us some really, really nice, quality, expensive dranky-drank.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, it's legit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's legit. Jim, that's ridiculous. And amazing. And thank you! We shall progressively enjoy it through the stream tonight. So here's to you, Jim. Thank you very much.

lines.name: MARISHA, TALIESIN
lines.text: To Jim!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (slurred) To Jim!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's tasty. Also, announcements from us! Any project or game announcements? I know this recently sparks the release of the Mad Max game that just came out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where's Orion?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Orion will be here in a second. He's missing his moment.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But Travis plays the lead villain!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Travis is the main villain! Scrotus!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes, Scabrous Scrotus. Who is in no way related to Grog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. He is large and has many curious accoutrements on his outfit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes he does! He has a giant horn on his crotch. Don't know what that's about.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Are we talking about Mad Max?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, we are.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Hey, he's Scrotus!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes! And you are?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I play Scab and a bunch of war boys. So check it out! Because I work with this guy here!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And I'm a war boy commander and a bunch of other guys, so you hear a lot of me going, "Get that guy!" And a lot of random NPCs giving quests.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I think you hear me barfing a lot during that game.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, man. That was a lot of dry heaving for like twenty minutes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah! Crazy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Always makes me actually want to barf. It makes my eyes water and be like, ugh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You know you've achieved it properly when the director goes, "Okay, no, we got it. Ugh." So yeah, Chris put us through the paces on our varying array of vomiting techniques on that project. So enjoy that in Mad Max! Also, same

lines.name: time, MGSV
lines.text: The Phantom Pain, for those of you who worked on that one. I know Marisha, if you want to talk about your involvement in that?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, oh-- Sam!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We have a Sam! Sam's arrived! Yay!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I'm one of the Diamond Dog soldiers that you can eventually recruit and play as, and so you can either shoot at me a lot and kill me a lot, or you can run around as me. And apparently once you get me I've got better stats than Big Boss, which is pretty fucking dope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Damn right, you do. I also voice a lot of the male Diamond Dog soldiers and enemy soldiers throughout the game, so you'll be shooting and capturing and recruiting a lot of me and Marisha throughout the game. Yeah, so check that out. Any other announcements?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yes! Speaking of Mad Max again, because it's super cool, I've actually partnered with Twitch as of ten days ago, so I'm doing my Twitch and I've been playing the shit out of Mad Max, so follow me on there! Orionacaba at Twitch, and check that shit out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You should play some Metal Gear.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Nope!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not until you beat Mad Max.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You should play some Borderlands.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'll go to your place and watch you play it because I want to watch you play your character.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Why don't you come to our place to watch Laura play Borderlands? We'll chain this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Guys, why don't we just LAN party and only play as characters we voice?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's not masturbatory at all.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No. Not at all.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yeah, that's weird.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can make a little ring.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes! Of narcissism!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Exactly.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Ew, that's gross.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cool! Do we have any other announcements?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh yeah, it's the start of the 2015 NFL football season. I'll be repping the Dallas Cowboys today. They're not playing right now, but they will be on Sunday. Go Cowboys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Awesome. For the four of you that are interested in football watching the stream--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We all come from different walks, all right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know. No, that's awesome. Cool! There we go.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Teach me of your ways.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughs) My sorcerer's ways.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But I'm learning!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There goes ball. Chase ball.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're growing! We're learning and growing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I am. I got really into rugby when we were in New Zealand. Oh, sports I can watch!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Rugby's dope, man. They're hardcore.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, they hit each other really hard. They call things a scrum. That sounds like fun.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. That's rugby. Scrum.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's intense, man.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, that's some brutal stuff.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. So we will have a Liam possibly joining us later in the evening. He had some family commitments tonight, but he's going to hope to try and join us around 8:30 or 9:00, if at all.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A wild Scanlan coming next to me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh no! We got Scanlan jumping ship now!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I've never been over here before.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: How does it feel on that side? When I played with Will Friedle--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I was on that side.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's weird. It does feel weird.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Everything flushes the other way around.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's how it works in this place, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is it colder over there? Are you guys in winter?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow, that's so weird!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know, it's awesome.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If it's something you want to donate to, it's a cool project, you get to watch me be all evil and cast--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I watched it. It's really fun.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) You can see me cast necromantic spells at Kevin Sorbo. I mean, what more could you want, really?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nothing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Our hair has a battle. It's wonderful.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Our mighty DM versus Hercules.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Indeed. I remember the first time we met on set, he came up to me, and goes like, "What's your "mother's name?" I still wonder. But anyway. Let us bring us back to the story. Now, Vox Machina, after completing the trials of the Slayer's Take and acquiring their marking brand as essence of them joining the actual guild itself, meeting the gynosphinx that is currently responsible--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (chuckles)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Such children. Responsible for the development and the progression of the guild itself, they found themselves having Pike join them for about a week's time while the landscape of her temple to Sarenrae was being cleansed of a curse, and the group decided to follow through on their promise to aid Keyleth on her Aramente to find the Pyrah people to the far southwest of Vasselheim.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ugh!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm burping garlic.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ugh. Garlic. Stinking Cloud over there. You thought he wasn't a caster. They made their way to the mountains, eventually to the actual Pyrah tribe itself, where they underwent a trial through the elemental plane of fire. Battled some of the druids, the Pyrah themselves, in elemental fire form, combated against time through a cinder storm as they attempted to escape, and managed to do so with their lives, and in doing so gained the blessing of the Aramente for Keyleth from the Pyrah tribe, as well as a blessing from the main druid as well, as a spark stone. And returned to Vasselheim, Pike then said her goodbyes again, returning to help the restoration of the temple of Sarenrae, and you've all been left to your devices now. So. As you all awaken the next morning within the guildhall itself, your journey and your path is your own to take.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We wake the next morning. Beard check, please.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Beard check. (laughs)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Zero. Or ten?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's zero.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's good.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It depends.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a hundred.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are you serious?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's the second time that's happened.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All you had to have rolled was a nine or anything other than a zero. That's all you had to-- anything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With a tiny methodical squeak, your pores produce but a few random molecules of hair-like material that then puff in the air around you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is it at least rough? Like, you know, he needs to shave, it's so rough.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nah, it's smooth as a baby's bottom.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well-oiled.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fine leather. That's what your face feels like.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: It's still 24 hours since we had the feast, right? It still counts as the same time?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The travel back to the town took about two and a half, three days, so that's been long past the feast. So the benefits of the Heroes' Feast have already been washed from your system.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where am I?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you returned, tired from the venture, went to sleep. You have spent the past week or so--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: On my own.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But upon leaving, realize that your party had left and been gone for some time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where are they? Where am I?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've just now found word they've returned to the Slayer's Take guildhall, and you've made your way in that direction this bright morning.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Because it's free to stay there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, we can stay there for free.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hello!

lines.name: LAURA, MARISHA
lines.text: Scanlan!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where have you guys been?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, Scanlan. You've just missed Pike!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?! Pike? Pike was here?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We took a field trip with her.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What are you talking about? Why didn't you call me? We have an earring!

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I used it twice, and you said, stop bothering me, Tiberius.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, I-- (sighs)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We were hearing very weird things from the other end of that ear piece

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Though he definitely said my name and told me to stop.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You didn't lead with Pike, though! You should have said, Pike's here. Hey, Pike's here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You probably should have done that.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: My bad.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (frustrated noise)

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Sorry about that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, I was having a fun time, but I would've dropped everything to be with Pike.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Well, a Stormwind likes to finish a sentence, and I apparently need to start a sentence correctly for you to hold your attention long enough.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't bury the lede. Pike first. Always Pike first.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Right. Sorry.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I wasn't even in a brothel.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, you weren't?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I walked toward the brothel, but then I bumped into Zahra. Remember Zahra?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, Zahra!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We were doing each other's hair, telling stories, playing songs. It was wonderful!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I roll to see if he's bullshitting?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can go ahead and make a-- this would be an insight.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are enthralled by his tale. Your elbows are on the edge of the bedspread right now with your hands clasped--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are my feet behind me, crisscrossing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are this close to a breakdown from Grease. It's pretty fantastic.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (singing) Tell me more, tell me more...

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It was great. We had a great PG night.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sounds like exactly what you needed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, then. That sounds like a wonderful time. It's all right that you missed Pike.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, except I would have dropped everything to come to see the woman I love, the woman of my dreams, the woman I will marry and bear children with. I don't know if she'll bear mine or I'll bear hers.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yes. How does it work with gnomes?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Gnomes, it's tricky.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yes, I've never seen a gnome birth, before.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You never know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Would it help if there were trolls?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, don't get me started.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right, so if there were trolls, it would be better that you missed everything. There weren't trolls, but if there had been, it would have been better.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, at least we're all together again.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We got to meet my family!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, what?!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I missed everything.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What did you do for all the days we've been gone now?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This was a long slumber party. We just kept going and going, and at one point, I was like, okay, I'll see you-- oh, there's another meal? Okay, I'll stick around for another day. And we just kept going.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did you do nails?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We did. Not my hands. Just my toenails.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We braided hair. We connected.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's wonderful.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Connected.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, at least we're all back. We can get on the flying carpet and go somewhere fun.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Who wants to--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Scanlan, you've missed everything!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe we should let Keyleth explain where the flying carpet went.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, Keyleth. Where is the flying carpet?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why do I have to explain it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're right. Tiberius, where did the flying carpet go?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: (swoosh) It just doesn't fly anymore.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You have a Bag of Holding?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I went to Draconia for like two minutes and picked one up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's really far.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh. Well, I teleported. I went there, came back.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So they killed the carpet. It lives no more. They also spent a lot of money. But hey, they didn't die, and that's a good thing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That is a good thing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And we fought a devil.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A demon.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Whoa! The devil?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: No, a rakshasa.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It seems that an enormous amount of alcohol has given you some perspective. I'm very proud of you. Well done.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's our mission now? What are we doing now?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That is a good question.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I have a suggestion. First I'm going to bring up Lockheed. Keyleth, if you think you could help?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What? I was gone for a day! There's a dragon now?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm going to take him out of his cage and put him on the table here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Aw, he's got puppy breath. Oh, yes you do. Yes you do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is slightly worse than puppy breath.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You want me to cure him of poison?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: He's diseased. You can maybe see if you could perhaps use your medicine strengths to see what the problem is.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, the Heroes' Feast would have worked.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yes, I know. That's why I asked earlier as the other guy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We did not have him with us then? We didn't have him with us when we had the feast?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You didn't think of him at the time?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I said I fed him, but I didn't say what I fed him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have a strange thought.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: When was the last time we went home?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, okay. Here's the thing. If we're going to go home-- Emon.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Greyskull.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right. If we're going to go home, I would really, really like to stop by Kraghammer.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And pick up our money.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. 25,000 gold.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If we're going to leave, could I make a small request?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You want to try again, don't you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have a bit of a chip on my shoulder.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Would you mind terribly if I maybe went out to the street and picked a fight?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, give me strength.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, go out on the street? You're not going to chase down what's-his-butt?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I want Kern.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, we're going to find Kern.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you sure about this?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm sure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hang on, are we going to go find Kern and do this with rules, or we going to do this without rules?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Without rules, you would win.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I can't do it. I have to do it by the rules.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So you want to go in the Crucible again.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Is there a tavern downstairs or anywhere they'd have cups or wineskins?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Within the guildhall, there is a mess hall area. A kitchen would have cups, but it's not a full tavern.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Tiberius, do you have any wineskins or anything?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Excuse me?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you have a wineskin?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh, I'm sorry. I was waiting on my first request before.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, what was your first request?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: To see if Keyleth could do anything, but a wineskin? Yes.

lines.name: LAURA, TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, thank you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do a check to see if I can tell what Lockheed has? What kind of disease?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure. Go ahead and make a medicine check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, it's sick? Get me away from it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21. Looking at Lockheed, you get the feeling that his disease essentially comes from a continuous time period of poor meat being presented as a meal option. It's less of a magical or any sort of unnatural disease. It's just something that is passing through his system.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Emaciated?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, if the food you've been feeding him has been a decent level, if this continues, it might clear. It could be aided through the use of simple healing salves and/or natural remedies.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I make a few Goodberries for him and feed him a few more Goodberries?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Why not great berries?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, I guess that's a matter of opinion, Percy.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: As far as the matters at hand: I, of course, Grog, encourage your violence. And Taliesin, I do quite like the idea of going back to Emon--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Who did you just-- who did you just--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You just NPCed me. Just NPCed me all over the place.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh, sorry. I'm sorry, speaking Draconic again. Percy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Sorry. No, that's not your mother's name.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's not my mother's name. She wasn't well. Carry on.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What was your mother's name?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm sorry. Percival. I go over to Percival and I give him a hug.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh god.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Sorry, I'm scaly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's all right. We didn't touch in my family. Go ahead.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I like the idea of going back to Emon, but before that, I do believe we should go back to Kraghammer and collect our gold.

lines.name: TALIESIN, LAURA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Did we say that already?

lines.name: TALIESIN, LAURA
lines.text: We did.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Wonderful. I was concerned about Lockheed.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So much has happened.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm going to put him on my shoulder.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did you say you encourage my violence?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Of course.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, Tiberius. You have to be careful. You have to be responsible--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Was there a window in the room?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, not in this one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay, just checking.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Was there a Looney Tunes hole in the wall? (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as Grog bounds off into the distance, do you guys give chase?

lines.name: ORION, TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get out into the main thoroughfare.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We really need to make that leash for him, like we said we were going to.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you make your way to the main thoroughfare, you look over and you catch the image of the distant goliath heading northward towards the Braving Grounds, just plowing through the crowd. You see a couple people that are knocked flat onto their ass, like head shaking, "what just happened?" as he just goes bounding into the distance.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Follow the trail of distressed people!

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I give chase. I give myself Fly so I can go over the crowd.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you glide over the crowd, you can see a few Bastions glance up and narrow their eyes and begin whispering to themselves.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: It's fine! I realize what I'm doing, and I stop.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's going on your tombstone: I realize what I'm doing, and I stop.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you enter the group, you, Percy, thanks to him, notice that there are now no less than five Bastions keeping a 30-foot distance walking and following behind Tiberius.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I go up and I tell Tiberius, maybe it's best just to keep a low profile for a while. And I turn around and wave at the Bastions.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's all right. He's from Emon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As soon as you wave and make that interaction, they break off in two and three and go in different directions and disappear into the crowd.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Cool. That was fun.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hunter's Mark one of them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I'll Hunter's Mark one of them.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Do they feel that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, wait. Can they feel that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a sleight-of-hand check on this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Natural 20, what!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's no crowd gathered. The Crucible is currently empty and left on its own. You glance about for a second, and there's nobody here running any sort of fight ring.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Damn it, you'll have to come back.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (shouting) Kern!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're shouting into the air, a few people nearby--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And the Star Trek reference is good. His name's Kern; it's fun.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nearby individuals drop their stuff and look over as this billowing, deep goliath voice fills the air around the center of this mildly business-as-usual road vicinity. Suddenly, a few individuals come looking out from inside the Bellows' Respite Inn. It has a tavern portion to the front. One of them is Once-Lucky Ned, who is the person that runs the tavern. He's a human barkeep that wanders out and, "You! Philip! Yelling Kern?" And you see this look on his face.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Bring me the body of Kern.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Alive! Alive.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: He wants to fight him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He cocks his head a little bit at you. "Just a moment. Stay right there." And he runs back inside.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's going to be a street fight!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I hear Scanlan say that and I run out and I say, (shouting) fight!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, other members of the tavern are starting to come out, tankards in hand, like, "what's going on?" They see you. "Oh! There's going to be a fight at the Crucible!" You hear the shouts going off the nearby houses; it's echoing, like town crier to town crier. You're hearing voices echo throughout the entirety of the Braving Grounds: people preparing for this midday unexpected throwdown. At this point, you see a few of the Bastions wearing the armor that is geared towards Kord, the god of strength that runs this portion of Vasselheim.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The ones that I'm keeping an eye on?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You! Hey, am I to hear properly that you are challenging our standing champion once again?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Aye, you heard right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Midday, now, under the noonday sun?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Aye, where everyone can see, and he can't hide.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He glances over to another Bastion that's to his left. "Get Kern. Now." He rushes off and he looks back to you. "Well, then. A fight we're going to have." At this point now, there's probably about 20, 25 people that are beginning to gather around the outskirts of the Crucible around you. "Oh, it's Philip! Philip's showing down with Kern!" There's all these different whispers now going throughout the crowd as the rest of you gather. The Bastion that you've been following backs off and stays further back, and is slowly keeping a distance further away as the crowd begins to gather, wanting to stay inconspicuous amongst all this chaos and rabble you guys have collected.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I join in with everybody else. Yeah, did you see that, Kern's fighting Philip!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Why are you telling me this? Of course I know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Kern's fighting--

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I also know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I try, subtly, to pass off my ring of AC to Grog?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog, do you have any enchantment of protection, currently?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do not?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On the ring, does it say attunement required?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No. It doesn't, I don't think. Hold on, let me look.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I can look it up for you, if need be.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ring of Protection.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, my Belt of Dwarvenkind is the only thing, but that's all.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It just says plus two bonus to AC and saving throw-- oh, requires attunement.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you have to take time to go ahead and attune to the magical item.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Damn it! I'm sorry, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's all right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You shouldn't have taken off running!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This has turned into full-on, "Morpheus is fighting Neo."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I turn to the bookie, and I take out my entire coin purse, and I throw it at him.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I use my Mage Hand--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, don't use magic!

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh no, I don't! I don't do that!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We whack him on the head before he starts to do the hand. Stop it!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I throw him the coin purse and I say, I expect to see that doubled when I get out. And I jump into the pit before Kern even arrives.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You leap and the whole crowd goes (cheering) and this series of shouting screams surround the air around you. He grabs the coin purse-- how much is in that coin purse?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: According to this, it's eleven-- that can't be right, can it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Personal funds?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your personal funds, not what's in the Bag of Holding.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 1,363 gold pieces.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's normal. He probably has more than that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You should start charging admission at the door.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I run up. There's a bookie here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is a bookie.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's three to one against him."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe I'll come and collect later.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I have 600 gold pieces--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't hear this.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll collect later. Don't say anything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Good chap, I'd like to place a bet. 500 gold pieces on Philip.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "On to Philip. All right. (laughs) 500."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm going to break my bank and follow suit to my human friend. 612 is, I think, all I have left.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Curious number, but certainly." At this time, the crowd gets a little more hushed, people are like, "Oh." And you see-- you don't see this, because you're down in the Crucible-- you see the crowd, which has probably gathered close to 70 plus people, part, and you see walking over, soot smeared across the front of his face, stepping up is Kern the Hammer, with a bristled, half-orc mustache, a little bit tousled from a day of hard work, sweat glistening off the top of his brow and the top of his head.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He's missing a lip.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As he approaches, you can see-- there has been some healing through the quick work of the clerics who worked after the last battle. However, there is definitely a section of his upper lip that is permanently missing, looking almost like a half-cleft palate. You can see beneath it, his sneering yellowed teeth grinding as he approaches the Crucible.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I believe in you, Philip.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to bet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're going to bet?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to bet. I'm going to put 600 on Philip!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So wait, this betting thing is enjoyable?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: No, it's not. It's a gamble.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It feels bad?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's terrible.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So why do we do it?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: So we can make more, and plus, it's giving faith in our friend.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's inspiration.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll bet five gold on Philip.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughs) That's an excellent bet. That is an excellent bet, Keyleth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thank you! Is that how it works?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You now notice the dark figure. The noonday sun is now high in the sky, and you can see, by the little bit of the shadowed outline of Kern, muscle-bound, looming over the edge of the Crucible. You hear a voice call down to you, low and gravelly and familiar. "You! Did you like the gift I sent you?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I reach into my belt and I pull out his upper lip, and I give it a smell and I say, I've enjoyed it very much. I've come to collect the rest. And I fling it into the pit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It hits the ground. "You're not wearing the medal. A shame, really. I thought you'd be more "proud of your status." (whoosh, thud). He leaps down into the pit right before you, this grin on his face. As everyone's gathering around, people are now swarming the bookie, handing gold left and right, and he's making notes in his little ledger out of his pocket. People are beginning to gather around and crush against the outsides of the Crucible with some people being careful, almost being pushed in. At this point in time, now, Kern's glaring at you and you guys are slowly circling each other. (grunts) "You've been training, I see. Good. So have I!" He goes and takes his wine skin, pops off the top--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hold! Surely a man of your stature would honor me by sharing a drink before this battle.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He takes (glugging) and throws you the wineskin.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How much is left in there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About a third. You're clutching it in your hand, and he's staring at you intently.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (sniff, sniff) I don't drink such piss water. I pour it out. I take out my own wineskin that I filled with the stone giant strength, and I chug it down.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's juicing!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh shit!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It tastes very heavily-- this is frost giant strength, you said?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Or the stone giant, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, the stone giant. It tastes very heavily of black charcoal, dust, grit, and the actual liquid itself has a very gravelly texture as it goes down your throat, and you can feel chunks getting caught, but you push through and continue gulping it. It's thicker, like a molasses, than it is an actual liquid. You finish it off, toss it to the side. Go ahead and mark your increase to strength for this.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You came prepared!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (singing) We're going to need a montage, a montage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Coins start raining on you: copper, silver, and gold pieces spin down on the ground around you, Grog. You guys just stand tensely locked in that warrior glare. "Challenging him, once again, "tail between his legs, intent on claiming his glory, returning to the Crucible, Philip."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm going to take yours this time, boy."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Enough words, toothless. Let's do this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll initiative.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, I get advantage, don't I? That's better. 20.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Music change!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How did you have that ready?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Witchcraft!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I keep all my stuff at the ready, just in case. All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are we that predictable?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I have a whole cluster over here. So what'd you get for initiative, in total?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There's papers just littering our apartment, just information.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Our house is a D&D cave.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog, you have initiative.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: The DDT!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The DDT!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. For this, go ahead and make an athletics check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay. (laughs) 25.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 18 plus seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He rolled a 23. 15 plus eight. So you rush up behind and he goes in for the feint, attempts to parry. However, you vanish from the side. He feels the arms wrap around him and he reaches down instinctively to try and pry them away, but it's too late as you lift him up off of his back and (whack) send him onto the ground. Go ahead and roll 1d2 plus your strength modifier.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 1d-what? Two?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, it's 1d4 divided by two.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Six, all right. (impact noise) So he took the damage. There's no attacks this round, currently; however, he is currently prone. He is prone on the ground right there. As you slam him onto the ground and release him, he falls to the ground and you hear (pained grunt) this exhale of pain. All right, you also have a bonus action, still.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right, with that action, I would like to go into-- does it take an action to rage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It takes a bonus action for you to rage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Which is what this is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Goes into his frenzied rage, as well. And he's coming at you with both fists. One thing you notice, strangely: Kern, who previously seemed to throw haymakers at you, before, goes into a stance.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's been training!

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: He monked up!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is going to be a-- Let's see, 24?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ooh, that is going to be a 27.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, that'll hit, too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, first hit is nine points of damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Second one is eight points of damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He got nine points of damage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (whack, whack) These fists, you see as they hit you, they're not just extremely strong and powerful previously, but they're hitting precise areas where you feel the muscle and bone is less resistant. There is technique to these punches that wasn't there before.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No problem!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's your go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right, I would like to enter a frenzied rage, and I would like to-- since he moves off to my side, I see him move, and I throw a back fist into the concave area of his nose.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 23 hits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Great. That is-- motherfucker, six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Six damage?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would like to then reach forward, as he's reeling back from that hit, with both of my thumbs and throw them towards his eyes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're going to attempt to blind? All right, so what this is going to be is for your second attack, a loose grapple, and we'll see if you can manage to push forward from that point. So go ahead and make an athletics check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14. That is going to be a 16 on his end, unfortunately. As you reach up, he (whoosh) slaps the hands away. His defensive posture-- he was ready for that sort of advance and he just knocks them to the side with a grin. Yeah. You do still have a bonus action, if you wish to use it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If he knocks it aside, I take my right leg and I throw it to the outside of his kneecap, trying to snap his ACL or MCL.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, go ahead and roll for the attack on that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a 27.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 27 does indeed hit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why didn't that happen before? That's seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seven points of damage? Oof, all right. As he pushes your hands out of the way, (whack) a resounding snap sound as your foot hits the side of his thigh. His leg muscles themselves are like a tree trunk and take most of the impact of the damage and you see him (pained cry). You can see the pain in his face. His grin gives way to a sudden grimace of pain. Your leg is now held in place; he resisted the full force of the blow to some physical damage himself, but not enough to knock the knee out. Do you want to move at all, or are you going to stay where you are?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would like to move to flank his right side.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Put him in a body bag!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you move over, with that it comes to his turn. As you're moving to the side, he spins around this time. You have not yet seen him move his legs to this extent, to a full back roundhouse kick towards your head. That is going to be a 20?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits, okay. Second attack is going to be a 19?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Next attack is going to be a 12, no, 13.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That misses.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So the roundhouse kick (whoosh) swings around, completely unexpected as you pull to the side. (smack) Hits you right square in the side of the face and jaw. That is going to be seven points of damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (whack, whack) Second one doing eight points of damage. (whack, whack)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay. All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (grunts, pants) I see you've been taking some ballet. How very cultured of you. And I rush forward. I'm between him and the wall?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are between him and the wall, yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay. (laughs)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I get up on Trinket's shoulders and cheer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (roars) Trinket roars with you. (roar) This roar of victory, which people around immediately take two steps away from the large bear that's suddenly roaring in the center. You guys are unfazed, too focused on each other.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I rush up and get him, give him a little nasty-- of the last time for a double thunderclap, to either side of his ears.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oof, okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That is a 13.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13. Unfortunately, as you go to swing, he (whoosh) ducks out of the way, and your hands slap into each other, finding no purchase on his head.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's all right. Since I didn't find any purchase, I'll see where his ears are, try and grab them, and I'm going to attempt to rip his ears off of his head. His nice pointy ears.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so your second attack is going to be to try and grab his ears. Go for it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16, no. As you go up for the one ear, he parries it to the side with his hand.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (sighs) Third attack. 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're (whoosh, whoosh) swinging at him, he seems to just be dodging out of the way. He still has the force behind him, but whatever he's picked up now has completely thrown you off. You weren't prepared. You were prepared for a bruiser. You've now seen, still a bruiser, but with a little more refined technique, and it's throwing you off your game. You need to resettle yourself. You need to pull yourself in, Grog. However, in that moment of thinking, he swings at you with a double pummel up towards the torso. That is a natural 20. That is going to be a 13.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh! Miss.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is yours, I believe. And that's going to be a nine. (laughs) Or, sorry, a ten. So first one hits, second two miss. (whack) The first one comes through and smacks you right in the center of the stomach. With a double hit, that's 14 points of damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would like to use my Stone's Endurance.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it. You, at that point as the punch hits your stomach, you flex, feeling the strength of the mountain fill your body, your ancestral roots of your stone giant brethren fill your form.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As he shakes away, he brings up his other hand to backhand you. You duck out of the way. He swings with a kick around with the momentum, and you catch it in the middle of the air. So we're going to start your turn with you now holding his leg up by the side of your head.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (yelling)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll for attack on this.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eight damage? All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe we can start a chant for inspiration.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, can we? Grog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So that's your first attack?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That was my first.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as you go (crash), bring it down, the knee-- a human's leg would have hyperextended, but the sheer size of muscle-- and this is comparable to your own-- you feel it definitely hurt and he's like (pained cry) yelp out in pain, but it's not enough to fully pop the leg back.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll a second attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That definitely hits. Go ahead and roll damage on that.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh my god, a Grog punch to the balls.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Eight. My first eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice! Second eight, actually. You've already rolled.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, that's right, okay.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kern is one of those individuals who's had his nuts kicked enough times in his life to know the pain well and be prepared for it. So as you come down, (whack) slam it right into him. You hear this (high, pained wail) almost wolf-like screeching howl as Kern's head lifts up in severe pain. His hands come down and grasp your wrist and is now holding it, trying to pull it away from his midsection. He's in a very bad situation right now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: With that last one, can I take my right leg and in an effort to shoot for that same knee I've been kicking at, aim for the knee or sweep his feet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, go for it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fuck. That'll miss. It's a 13.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13. As you pull back to sweep, Kern uses this advantage to bring up the other leg that you haven't hit, plant it right on your shoulder and neck area, and then push off your body. As you sweep underneath, he leaps backward, flipping in the air. (thud) Lands on both of his feet, clutching the inside of his groin area, like (snarling grunt) shaking off the pain through the anger. So he leaps back to here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: As that's happening, we all start a chant.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: (chanting) Grog, Grog, Grog.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: As they're chanting, I'm starting to sing amid the chant. (singing) It's the eye of the goliath, it's the thrill of the fight. Rising up to the challenge of that asshole. (speaking) And I'm trying to send inspiration to him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now Kern, having landed on his feet, rushes forward towards you, and first using his bonus action, is going to go ahead and reach down for a very deep uppercut. It looks like he's coming in for a left, and sweeps down to try and take you from underneath, breaking through your defense. That is going to be a 20.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take ten points of damage. Right to the chin from underneath. For the bonus action, Kern then comes back, and you're used to an unleashed flurry. Kern, however, comes back into a fully defensive position, righting his hands and leg in a backwards stance, and is just looking at you, ready for you to come. He's using his action to go into a dodge. It's now your turn.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, wait, so he gets some sort of advantage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All attacks against him have disadvantage this next turn.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: advantage, because balls.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Damn it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The balls doesn't give advantage?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: No, he has tough nuts. Never mind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He has the feat Toughness, which I think really resists any sort of ball damage at this point.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: In an effort to keep my distance, I run towards him, I jump up in the air and throw one thrust-kick towards the side, right towards his chest, just to see what his defense will do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it. With disadvantage, so roll twice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh god. Mother bitch!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, that was a natural 20, but 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19. Total 19?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Total 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That just barely hits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I add the inspiration to the-- no, just to the roll, right. That is an eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eight. So.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Halved. So half of three is one and a half, and we're rounding up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Rounding up, yeah. Three and four is a two, considered.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right, so eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. All right. So you rush up, (whack) slamming. He puts the defense out and tries to push to the side. However, his defense is imperfect; you can see he's still new to this fighting style, and you still manage to push through with sheer force and slam into the side of his torso from the impact.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I leap forward again and try to throw my thumbs into his eyes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you're going for the blind again. Go ahead and roll an attack on this, with disadvantage.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Inspiration!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If you want to use it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you rush forward to grab. You have hold of his head now. There's no damage this round, but you're enabling yourself now for the rest of the round to attempt to push into his eyes. There's no damage on this one. You grab the side of his head, and you see his eyes open with this look of fear at the unexpected ferocity from you. Go ahead and make an athletics check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Come on, Grog!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 24. He rolled a 19, so go ahead and do damage on this. Roll damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: With the four? Six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Six, all righty. So as you have a hold of his head, you grin as your thumbs push into his eyes. He yells out in pain, and before you can damage the eyes permanently, he slaps off of your hands so hard and with such an intense push that you can't help but feel your actual forearms be blown back. However, he's clutching the side of his face, and for the next round, he is blinded.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I move?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can move, as well.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I just back straight up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Back this way? He currently doesn't threaten you because he's blinded, so you can rush past him and not get an attack of opportunity.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, really?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll move along the wall to his left side.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Over here?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To there?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But back up?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And back up just a little bit. Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, Kern does attempt to sidestep over. He's going to attempt to make three strikes at you, with a disadvantage on all of them because he's currently blinded.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right, you seem to be rolling pretty high. You could use the dice that I threw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And rolls against him have advantage as well. All right, so attacks against you. That is going to be a 14.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Misses!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Natural 20 or an eight. So that'll be 16.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay, that misses.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19 and 19. Another one does hit. So, wide punches forward. They're a foot away from you. You chuckle, getting out of the way, and as you chuckle, he hears that. (snap) And for a moment, his mind clarifies, even though his eyes are closed with a trickle of blood off the side of one of the eye. He immediately goes into a faster-than-you-expected midsection punch that (whack) smacks you right in the middle of your laughing stomach. Because you're laughing, there is that tension, but it wasn't flexed, prepared for an actual impact from a fist. And you take seven points of damage from the hit to your abdomen.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is your turn. He is still blinded, so you have advantage on all these attacks. As you reel from the hit to your midsection--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I want to move-- no, I'll stay right where I am. Can I reach forward, grab his head and his shoulder, and go in for a bite attack at his neck?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You certainly can.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (growls) Yes! Aiming for the jugular. 23.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 23? Definitely hits. Go ahead and roll damage on that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right. Eight.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're sure you're adding that right?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's just plus four?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Plus six. This is halved.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's no halves!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, we halve the die.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is that true?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both of them are at half damage because of their raging, so we're considering them both to not count that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So they're not counting the halves?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So he shouldn't be halving his die?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, no. The die halving is the natural damage of a punch, 1d2. So it's half of a d4.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Got it. Sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Except for Kern, who is currently doing a full d4 on his punches. For some reason! (laughs) All right. So. As you rush in, he puts out a hand to try and punch instinctively as you rush towards him, his eyes still coated in his own blood. You push to the side, reach in, and grab the back of his shoulder, and (crunching sound) Grog-bite into the side. It's like biting into a tree trunk, his skin is so thick.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I eat bar stools for dinner.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do, actually, and the taste is similar, Your teeth grind in, and you find yourself tearing into probably what would be the toughest steak you've ever tried. You get about a quarter to a half an inch in with your teeth, definitely taking a chunk and (tearing sound) tearing out what you can, but based on the general hardiness of his half-orc structure, you don't get to a jugular or any major vein, but you do leave a gash that leaves a significant mark on his body. That's the first attack.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I pull back from the bite, and I whisper into his ear, I was wondering what was going to break first: your spirit, or your body. And I would like to try to pick him up over my head and bring him down on my knee, Bane-style.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Batman!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make an athletics check. With advantage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay, that's 25.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do I need to roll on advantage to see if I get a 20?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, go for it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, it's a 19. It was so close! 26.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Son of a bitch!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You reach forward and scoop him up, lifting him over your head. He's trying to resist it, but in his unable-to-see state, there's no way he can possibly resist this. You lift him up over the top, (whack) down onto the knee. Go ahead and roll damage. I will consider both your two final attacks, but this attack damage is doubled, modifier included.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. As part of this, he is--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh no. He's going to pull some shit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Matt reaching for things is never good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm going to go ahead and make a constitution check on his end. The DC is going to be the damage dealt, so he's going to try and essentially resist the effect of this. He is at disadvantage because he's blinded. That is a three. An 18 and a three. However, he still has a high constitution and so that's still plus 9 to that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No longer blinded, but Kern is currently (choking noises) reaching towards his back, where there's this shooting pain throughout his entire nervous system. You have another round to go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (yelling)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's so brutal!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Go ahead and roll. Attacks have advantage on him because he's stunned.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's better. 23.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 23 hits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You know what? Just three of them. (battle cry)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just rage-stomping on him? Okay! Three attacks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20 hits.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're right. This is so much more exciting when you bet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you bring your leg up again to stomp a third time, this time Kern rolls out of the way. He manages to just avoid the third slam. What's the total damage on that?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did I roll? It's good. Eight and eight!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Damn!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You turned him into a stain.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kern, no longer stunned, now gets up, (grunts) holding the back of his side.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You suck, Kern!

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: You also smell!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's going to attempt a grapple at you. Go ahead and make an athletics check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you get an advantage at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are considered currently grappled. All right, so for the action there-- as a bonus action he's going to rear back, open his mouth, and attempt to bite towards your face.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's Mike Tyson-ing you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. That is a 21.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (disgusted noises)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We can fix it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your turn, currently grappled so you can't move.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would like to attempt to break that grapple.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Make an athletics check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That is 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He rolled a 14. So you break from the grapple. Still have your bonus action.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Both of my bonus actions, or all three?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, breaking from grapple-- let me double-check. It uses an action, so yeah, it's your action. You still have a bonus action.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I blow through my newly lipless mouth, (laughs) and I run up and I throw my face into his.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay! Go ahead and roll for your headbutt.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, as you look down, Kern has already swished beneath you. The sheer speed is unexpected; he's now beneath looking up and grabs the chunk of the lip that he had taken and comes up for a full round of attacks against you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wait, that was just my one attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, that's right. You still have-- No, you used your action to break the grapple. So you're still grappled, so you can't move. So this is his turn.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I broke the grapple!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You did break the grapple, so yeah, you could still move if you wanted to.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, I'll stay there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. That is a 23.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 23. And a 12.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (sighs) Misses.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, grabs the lip in one hand, reaches up and then (slam) uppercuts you from underneath for the first hit. That is seven points of damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (shouting) I saw that, Kern!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Still working on the same spot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Miss.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Still have two more strikes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21 hits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And I miss.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So, you rush forward with your leg (whoomph) he manages to duck out of the way, bringing his knee up to the side. Comes down to try and get ready for the next attack; however, you already used that inertia of the kick to bring your fist down (whack) right across the front of his face. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's an eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eight. All right. Okay, and the third strike, you come out to follow that up with a full combo, at which point however, he reaches out, (clutching noise) grabs the sides of your wrists with both of his hands and brings it down to where you're now face-to-face again, left at his mercy at this point. You're off-balance and led towards him. It's Kern's turn. Kern is going to reach back and attempt to headbutt you in the front. That is a 21.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is an 11.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Misses.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And that's going to be a 22.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, at that point, he pulls you closer in towards him, still holding your wrists to his side, and he headbutts you a third time. So, the first headbutt does nine points of damage, and the other one does seven points of damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (whack, whoosh, whack) Pulling you in, this time releasing you from the sheer impact, pushing you back onto your feet. It's your go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Am I back to the wall?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're pretty close to the wall, yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'd like to take a step back, put my back foot on the wall, and then push off into the air with a huge overhand right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice! Okay, pushing off in the air and arcing down with the fist.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 22 hits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Eight points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eight points of damage. All righty.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nice! 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25, that definitely hits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That is seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. (whack) With another screeching (howls in pain) your foot immediately cracks right. You've now repeatedly pummeled him into his man-bits, and you can see there is a dark stain in his trousers when you pull your foot back. You've definitely drawn blood in his nether regions.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, Kord. That is painful.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is he still standing? Is he bent over?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's standing partially bent forward, clutching towards the severe pain in his nether regions.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What? Did you lose something? No? You'll lose it now. And I do it again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Eight!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eight. All righty.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank you, Percy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Half-orc this may be; in this moment, Kern's gone full orc.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You feel yourself pulled off balance, and the momentum pull you towards him as he unleashes another flurry of blows against you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: As he does, I shout out from the audience using my Cutting Words.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What do you shout?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, Kern, do you need some dick? Because I gave some to your mom last night! (laughing and jeering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll a d10, and I'll subtract it from his attack roll.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: That was a burn.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fuck! Only three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's okay. So, his roll was a 21, that brings it down to an 18. What's your armor class?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Still, that was awesome! You can see there's a momentary distraction as Kern glances over for a second angrily, but still follows through with the first hit, this one clocking you straight in the face, sending your head back in severe pain. You take ten points of damage. (whack) You fall backward, the force of the blow sending you onto your heels. Second strike comes in at a 15. I believe that misses.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, that misses. Yeah, sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's your turn.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So, is that-- I was just saying, if we get another chant going--

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: (chanting) Grog, Grog, Grog.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Cover me. I cast Healing Word on Grog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, I'm going to ask you to do a sleight-of-hand check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Do I get advantage because we're all chanting together?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: What if I shot off a Prestidigitation firework?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: To help me out? Will it be a team effort? No? All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Doing this now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, that's good, that's a 16. 18 total.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (chuckles) As you begin casting, one of the Bastions grabs your wrist and pulls you into his face and says, "I'm sorry, missy. Am I to understand that you're cheating?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No! That's just the language of my people.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: She's foreign.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, I'm foreign.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a deception roll. It would be with disadvantage, but because Tiberius is helping you, we're just gonna make it a straight roll.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Deception?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Deception.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 11 total, because charisma.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Bastion says, "You're coming with me."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why do I always get busted?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Can I do something real quick?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Scanlan was going to act first, and then we'll get to you.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I want to be like, excuse me, and I-- sorry.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I said, I see this happening. I go over and I use Friends to cast--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're about to walk over, Tiberius puts his hand out and goes--

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: She's foreign, and she's royalty. Please, I'm from Draconia. She's from-- she's a druid. I say all this shit really quick, and I'm like, I'm so, so sorry.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I worship the ever-loving unicorn, Rainbow Fluffers.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a deception check with disadvantage, because he's already pissed off with this.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: What was it? Deception?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He rolled a 12 and a 13.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Deception? So that's 22 and 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The Bastion glares at you, looks over at one of the nearby Bastions. You see two manacles clank down on your wrists. Another Bastion to your left and the Bastion that's holding you both says, "Apparently, she's got people helping her out. Come on. We're dragging "her off." You both are being pulled away

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: As they do that, I'm like, you said dragon!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are being dragged away from the Crucible. Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's my turn?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is your turn.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I come back from that knee to the solar plexus.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right, guys, have fun! Root for Grog for us!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I reach out and grab the back of his head, and I drive my elbow straight into his chin.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25 does hit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes! Eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: As it carries through, I'd like to come back with a back elbow, same spot. Boom.

lines.name: MATT

lines.text: 13. Kern simply slaps it out of your way, and you can see the fear begin to fade, and for a second, looks at you and sees, truly, how close on the edge you are. "Oh, you've proven yourself this "day, but there is only one champion of the Crucible." You're up, Scanlan.

I lift him up over my head so that his head gets to come up and look at the crowd one last time before sending him straight back onto his shoulder blades and neck and smashing him into the earth!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (smash) With a resounding slam, Kern's body impacts into the stone floor of the Crucible, a cloud of dirt and dust (whoosh) around. Rocks break off and tumble down the side of the walls of the Crucible as the crowd has to stop themselves from falling in from the sheer impact of the tremor that you've left slamming Kern. You can see everyone fall silent; the crowd's cheers all come to a sudden halt. The dust settles. You can see nothing at the base of the Crucible. As the cloud slowly comes to rest, you see there, broken and laid out on the ground is an unconscious, bloodied, and ruined Kern, as Grog steps forward, head hunched beneath his billowing shoulders, fists clenched in anger, victorious in the center of the Crucible.

You go ahead and heal-- that's shitty rolls-- ten. I should've just rolled that one there. You heal 22 hit points, but you feel your lip fuse, and while it might leave a very small scar, it is in one piece. You might want to be careful about spitting or anything too heavy with it for the next few days for fear of jettisoning it from the front of your face accidentally.

lines.text: "However, I don't want to deal with the processing and the time it takes, so if these are "indeed your charges and you're willing to fill out some paperwork and pay the fines right now, we'll "relinquish them to you."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: As I leave, he's speaking Draconian!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think he's having an aneurysm.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: He's speaking Draconian! I heard him.

lines.name: LAURA

lines.name: ORION

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Hold it!

lines.name: LAURA

People are retelling the tale of the battle in the Cauldron of the rise of Grog the Victorious.

lines.name: ORION

lines.name: TRAVIS

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (shushing noises) There are maybe two men looking like late teens to early twenties who saw the fight and are currently like wide doe-eyed, seeing a hero before them.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I walk over to one of them and I pull out a gold coin and I say, how would you like to make a gold coin, son?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh boy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wait!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "From you, Grog the Victorious? Of course! What can I do?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Of course." And he runs off.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You sick fucks! (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
